body_html:
@ebrevdo: maybe you can help @alrojo (and perhaps me) here. If it seems too complicated to talk through github, I'll meet you offline.

Maybe, let's look at the two functions loop_fn_train (line 39) and loop_fn (for eval, line 87) in this file. Are these good starting points to talk?

I will be on standby with further development of the kernel_tests and the decoder_fn_attention until we have agreed on an interface between the rnn_decoder and decoder_fn then.

I am also available on skype/hangout/appear.in today and from Friday onwards in the morning hours (as I will be gmt +1 from Friday).

body:
> @ebrevdo: maybe you can help @alrojo (and perhaps me) here. If it seems too complicated to talk through github, I'll meet you offline.
> 
> Maybe, let's look at the two functions loop_fn_train (line 39) and loop_fn (for eval, line 87) in this file. Are these good starting points to talk?

I will be on standby with further development of the `kernel_tests` and the `decoder_fn_attention` until we have agreed on an interface between the `rnn_decoder` and `decoder_fn` then.

I am also available on skype/hangout/appear.in today and from Friday onwards in the morning hours (as I will be gmt +1 from Friday).
